question: The shaded region in the figure given (with points <katex>$(0,7), B(3,4), C(0,2), A(7,0)$</katex>) is the solution of which of the inequalities?
explanation: The region is bounded by lines passing through <katex>$(0,7)-(7,0)$</katex> and <katex>$(0,2)-(-3,0)$</katex>. Point <katex>$(3,4)$</katex> is the intersection.
Line 1: <katex>$(0,7), (7,0) \implies x+y=7$</katex>. The region is below this line (origin side), so <katex>$x+y \le 7$</katex>.

Check origin <katex>$(0,0)$</katex> for region. The shaded region (triangle ABC) includes points like <katex>$(1,2)$</katex>. At <katex>(1,2)</katex>: <katex>$2(1)-3(2)+6 = 2-6+6 = 2 \ge 0$</katex>. So <katex>$2x-3y+6 \ge 0$</katex>.
